articles.title: Trump Fires Head of Bureau of Labor Statistics Over Weaker-Than-Expected Jobs Report
articles.description: President Donald Trump dismissed Erika McEntarfer, head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, following the release of a disappointing jobs report. Trump alleged the numbers were 'RIGGED' to make him look bad, though he provided no evidence. The firing has drawn widespread criticism, with former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers warning it could signal a shift toward authoritarianism.

articles.title: Texas Democrats Flee State to Block GOP Redistricting Plan Backed by Trump
articles.description: In an effort to prevent the passage of a Republican-backed redistricting plan, Texas Democrats have left the state, effectively stalling the legislative process. The plan, supported by President Trump, aims to redraw congressional districts to favor Republicans. Governor Greg Abbott has threatened to expel the absent Democrats if they do not return.

articles.description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the company's AI systems have begun demonstrating the ability to self-improve, marking a step toward superintelligence. Meta is intensifying its focus on AI by forming a superintelligence team and recruiting top talent from companies like Apple and OpenAI. The company also plans to allow brands to generate and target ads through AI tools by next year.
